Tree¶

class pygly.tree_node.TreeNode[source]¶

Base class for Tree branch objects.

Supports a single parent. Can have 0-N children.

__init__()[source]¶

Creates a tree node object.

add_child(node)[source]¶

Attaches a child to the node.

Note

Dispatches an ‘on_child_added’ event.

Raises:
ValueError: Raised if the child already has a parent.
bfs()[source]¶
children[source]¶
dfs()[source]¶
event_types = ['on_parent_changed', 'on_child_added', 'on_child_removed', 'on_transform_changed']¶
parent[source]¶

The parent of the node or None if there isn’t one.

The parent value should not be changed manually. Instead use the ‘remove_child’ method on the parent.

Note

When the parent value is changed, the ‘on_parent_changed’ event will be dispatched.

Note

This is an @property decorated method which allows retrieval and assignment of the scale value.

Raises:
ValueError: Raised is the node already has a parent. ValueError: Raised if the node is not a child of the new parent. This is handled internally.
predecessors()[source]¶
remove_child(node)[source]¶

Removes a child from the node.

Note

Dispatches an ‘on_child_removed’ event.

Raises:
KeyError: Raised if the node is not a child of the node.
class pygly.tree_leaf.TreeLeaf[source]¶

Base class for Tree Leaf objects.

Supports a single parent. Cannot have children.

__init__()[source]¶

Creates a tree leaf object.

parent[source]¶

The current parent of the node or None if there isn’t one.

This is an @property decorated method which allows retrieval and assignment of the scale value.

predecessors()[source]¶

Returns successive parents of the node.

Generator function that allows iteration up the tree.
